title: Battle of Agua Dulce
summary: The Battle of Agua Dulce Creek was a skirmish during the Texas Revolution between Mexican troops and rebellious colonists of the Mexican province of Texas, known as Texians.  As part of the Goliad Campaign to retake the Texas Gulf Coast, Mexican troops ambushed a group of Texians on March 2, 1836.  The skirmish began approximately 26 miles (42Â km) south of San Patricio, in territory belonging to the Mexican state of Tamaulipas.
